meanings.definition: A substance that forms a gel when mixed with water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrocolloid in the recipe helped thicken the soup.
meanings.sent2: The nurse applied a hydrocolloid dressing to the wound to promote healing.
meanings.sent3: The hydrocolloid decided to take a swim in the water and turned into a gel!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like a hydrocolloid, absorbing all the information and forming a solid plan.
meanings.sent5: The hydrocolloid transformed the liquid into a solid, just like magic.

meanings.definition: A material that can absorb and retain water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrocolloid in the diaper kept the baby dry all night.
meanings.sent2: The hydrocolloid used in gardening helps retain moisture in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The hydrocolloid was so thirsty, it drank up all the water in the glass!
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a hydrocolloid, soaking up every detail and keeping it safe.
meanings.sent5: The hydrocolloid acted like a sponge, soaking in all the water around it.
